cards.term: agoraphobia
cards.definition: anxiety disorder characterized by intense fear, anxiety, and avoidance of situations in which it might be difficult to escape if one experiences symptoms of a panic attack

cards.term: anxiety disorder characterized by intense fear, anxiety, and avoidance of situations in which it might be difficult to escape if one experiences symptoms of a panic attack
cards.definition: agoraphobia

cards.term: antisocial personality disorder
cards.definition: characterized by a lack of regard for others' rights, impulsivity, deceitfulness, irresponsibility, and lack of remorse over misdeeds

cards.term: characterized by a lack of regard for others' rights, impulsivity, deceitfulness, irresponsibility, and lack of remorse over misdeeds
cards.definition: antisocial personality disorder

cards.term: anxiety disorder
cards.definition: characterized by excessive and persistent fear and anxiety, and by related disturbances in behavior

cards.term: characterized by excessive and persistent fear and anxiety, and by related disturbances in behavior
cards.definition: anxiety disorder

cards.term: attention deficit/hyperactivity disorder
cards.definition: childhood disorder characterized by inattentiveness and/or hyperactive, impulsive behavior

cards.term: childhood disorder characterized by inattentiveness and/or hyperactive, impulsive behavior
cards.definition: attention deficit/hyperactivity disorder

cards.term: atypical
cards.definition: describes behaviors or feelings that deviate from the norm

cards.term: describes behaviors or feelings that deviate from the norm
cards.definition: atypical

cards.term: autism spectrum disorder
cards.definition: childhood disorder characterized by deficits in social interaction and communication, and repetitive patterns of behavior or interests

cards.term: childhood disorder characterized by deficits in social interaction and communication, and repetitive patterns of behavior or interests
cards.definition: autism spectrum disorder

cards.term: bipolar and related disorders
cards.definition: group of mood disorders in which mania is the defining feature

cards.term: group of mood disorders in which mania is the defining feature
cards.definition: bipolar and related disorders

cards.term: bipolar disorder
cards.definition: mood disorder characterized by mood states that vacillate between depression and mania

cards.term: mood disorder characterized by mood states that vacillate between depression and mania
cards.definition: bipolar disorder

cards.term: body dysmorphic disorder
cards.definition: involves excessive preoccupation with an imagined defect in physical appearance

cards.term: involves excessive preoccupation with an imagined defect in physical appearance
cards.definition: body dysmorphic disorder

cards.term: borderline personality disorder
cards.definition: instability in interpersonal relationships, self-image, and mood, as well as impulsivity; key features include intolerance of being alone and fear of abandonment, unstable relationships, unpredictable behavior and moods, and intense and inappropriate anger

cards.term: instability in interpersonal relationships, self-image, and mood, as well as impulsivity; key features include intolerance of being alone and fear of abandonment, unstable relationships, unpredictable behavior and moods, and intense and inappropriate anger
cards.definition: borderline personality disorder

cards.term: catatonic behavior
cards.definition: decreased reactivity to the environment; includes posturing and catatonic stupor

cards.term: decreased reactivity to the environment; includes posturing and catatonic stupor
cards.definition: catatonic behavior

cards.term: comorbidity
cards.definition: co-occurrence of two disorders in the same individual

cards.term: co-occurrence of two disorders in the same individual
cards.definition: comorbidity

cards.term: delusion
cards.definition: belief that is contrary to reality and is firmly held, despite contradictory evidence

cards.term: belief that is contrary to reality and is firmly held, despite contradictory evidence
cards.definition: delusion

cards.term: depersonalization/derealization disorder
cards.definition: dissociative disorder in which people feel detached from the self (depersonalization), and the world feels artificial and unreal (derealization)

cards.term: dissociative disorder in which people feel detached from the self (depersonalization), and the world feels artificial and unreal (derealization)
cards.definition: depersonalization/derealization disorder

cards.term: depressive disorder
cards.definition: one of a group of mood disorders in which depression is the defining feature

cards.term: one of a group of mood disorders in which depression is the defining feature
cards.definition: depressive disorder

cards.term: diagnosis
cards.definition: determination of which disorder a set of symptoms represents

cards.term: determination of which disorder a set of symptoms represents
cards.definition: diagnosis

cards.term: Diagnostic and Statistical Manual of Mental Disorders, Fifth Edition (DSM-5)
cards.definition: authoritative index of mental disorders and the criteria for their diagnosis; published by the American Psychiatric Association (APA)

cards.term: authoritative index of mental disorders and the criteria for their diagnosis; published by the American Psychiatric Association (APA)
cards.definition: Diagnostic and Statistical Manual of Mental Disorders, Fifth Edition (DSM-5)

cards.term: diathesis-stress model
cards.definition: suggests that people with a predisposition for a disorder (a diathesis) are more likely to develop the disorder when faced with stress; model of psychopathology

cards.term: suggests that people with a predisposition for a disorder (a diathesis) are more likely to develop the disorder when faced with stress; model of psychopathology
cards.definition: diathesis-stress model

cards.term: disorganized thinking
cards.definition: disjointed and incoherent thought processes, usually detected by what a person says

cards.term: disjointed and incoherent thought processes, usually detected by what a person says
cards.definition: disorganized thinking

cards.term: disorganized/abnormal motor behavior
cards.definition: highly unusual behaviors and movements (such as child-like behaviors), repeated and purposeless movements, and displaying odd facial expressions and gestures

cards.term: highly unusual behaviors and movements (such as child-like behaviors), repeated and purposeless movements, and displaying odd facial expressions and gestures
cards.definition: disorganized/abnormal motor behavior

cards.term: dissociative amnesia
cards.definition: dissociative disorder characterized by an inability to recall important personal information, usually following an extremely stressful or traumatic experience

cards.term: dissociative disorder characterized by an inability to recall important personal information, usually following an extremely stressful or traumatic experience
cards.definition: dissociative amnesia

cards.term: dissociative disorders
cards.definition: group of DSM-5 disorders in which the primary feature is that a person becomes dissociated, or split off, from his or her core sense of self, resulting in disturbances in identity and memory

cards.term: group of DSM-5 disorders in which the primary feature is that a person becomes dissociated, or split off, from his or her core sense of self, resulting in disturbances in identity and memory
cards.definition: dissociative disorders

cards.term: dissociative fugue
cards.definition: symptom of dissociative amnesia in which a person suddenly wanders away from one's home and experiences confusion about his or her identity

cards.term: symptom of dissociative amnesia in which a person suddenly wanders away from one's home and experiences confusion about his or her identity
cards.definition: dissociative fugue

cards.term: dissociative identity disorder
cards.definition: dissociative disorder (formerly known as multiple personality disorder) in which a person exhibits two or more distinct, well-defined personalities or identities and experiences memory gaps for the time during which another identity emerged

cards.term: dissociative disorder (formerly known as multiple personality disorder) in which a person exhibits two or more distinct, well-defined personalities or identities and experiences memory gaps for the time during which another identity emerged
cards.definition: dissociative identity disorder

cards.term: dopamine hypothesis
cards.definition: theory of schizophrenia that proposes that an overabundance of dopamine or dopamine receptors is responsible for the onset and maintenance of schizophrenia

cards.term: theory of schizophrenia that proposes that an overabundance of dopamine or dopamine receptors is responsible for the onset and maintenance of schizophrenia
cards.definition: dopamine hypothesis

cards.term: etiology
cards.definition: cause or causes of a psychological disorder

cards.term: cause or causes of a psychological disorder
cards.definition: etiology

cards.term: flashback
cards.definition: psychological state lasting from a few seconds to several days, during which one relives a traumatic event and behaves as though the event were occurring at that moment

cards.term: psychological state lasting from a few seconds to several days, during which one relives a traumatic event and behaves as though the event were occurring at that moment
cards.definition: flashback

cards.term: flight of ideas
cards.definition: symptom of mania that involves an abruptly switching in conversation from one topic to another

cards.term: symptom of mania that involves an abruptly switching in conversation from one topic to another
cards.definition: flight of ideas

cards.term: generalized anxiety disorder
cards.definition: characterized by a continuous state of excessive, uncontrollable, and pointless worry and apprehension

cards.term: characterized by a continuous state of excessive, uncontrollable, and pointless worry and apprehension
cards.definition: generalized anxiety disorder

cards.term: grandiose delusion
cards.definition: characterized by beliefs that one holds special power, unique knowledge, or is extremely important

cards.term: characterized by beliefs that one holds special power, unique knowledge, or is extremely important
cards.definition: grandiose delusion

cards.term: hallucination
cards.definition: perceptual experience that occurs in the absence of external stimulation, such as the auditory hallucinations (hearing voices) common to schizophrenia

cards.term: perceptual experience that occurs in the absence of external stimulation, such as the auditory hallucinations (hearing voices) common to schizophrenia
cards.definition: hallucination

cards.term: harmful dysfunction model
cards.definition: of psychological disorders resulting from the inability of an internal mechanism to perform its natural function

cards.term: of psychological disorders resulting from the inability of an internal mechanism to perform its natural function
cards.definition: harmful dysfunction model

cards.term: hoarding disorder
cards.definition: characterized by persistent difficulty in parting with possessions, regardless of their actual value or usefulness

cards.term: characterized by persistent difficulty in parting with possessions, regardless of their actual value or usefulness
cards.definition: hoarding disorder

cards.term: hopelessness theory
cards.definition: cognitive theory of depression proposing that a style of thinking that perceives negative life events as having stable and global causes leads to a sense of hopelessness and then to depression

cards.term: cognitive theory of depression proposing that a style of thinking that perceives negative life events as having stable and global causes leads to a sense of hopelessness and then to depression
cards.definition: hopelessness theory

cards.term: International Classification of Diseases (ICD)
cards.definition: authoritative index of mental and physical diseases, including infectious diseases, and the criteria for their diagnosis; published by the World Health Organization (WHO)

cards.term: authoritative index of mental and physical diseases, including infectious diseases, and the criteria for their diagnosis; published by the World Health Organization (WHO)
cards.definition: International Classification of Diseases (ICD)

cards.term: locus coeruleus
cards.definition: area of the brainstem that contains norepinephrine, a neurotransmitter that triggers the body's fight-or-flight response; has been implicated in panic disorder

cards.term: area of the brainstem that contains norepinephrine, a neurotransmitter that triggers the body's fight-or-flight response; has been implicated in panic disorder
cards.definition: locus coeruleus

cards.term: major depressive disorder
cards.definition: commonly referred to as "depression" or "major depression," characterized by sadness or loss of pleasure in usual activities, as well other symptoms

cards.term: commonly referred to as "depression" or "major depression," characterized by sadness or loss of pleasure in usual activities, as well other symptoms
cards.definition: major depressive disorder

cards.term: mania
cards.definition: state of extreme elation and agitation

cards.term: state of extreme elation and agitation
cards.definition: mania

cards.term: manic episode
cards.definition: period in which an individual experiences mania, characterized by extremely cheerful and euphoric mood, excessive talkativeness, irritability, increased activity levels, and other symptoms

cards.term: period in which an individual experiences mania, characterized by extremely cheerful and euphoric mood, excessive talkativeness, irritability, increased activity levels, and other symptoms
cards.definition: manic episode

cards.term: mood disorder
cards.definition: one of a group of disorders characterized by severe disturbances in mood and emotions; the categories of mood disorders listed in the DSM-5 are bipolar and related disorders and depressive disorders

cards.term: one of a group of disorders characterized by severe disturbances in mood and emotions; the categories of mood disorders listed in the DSM-5 are bipolar and related disorders and depressive disorders
cards.definition: mood disorder

cards.term: negative symptom
cards.definition: characterized by decreases and absences in certain normal behaviors, emotions, or drives, such as an expressionless face, lack of motivation to engage in activities, reduced speech, lack of social engagement, and inability to experience pleasure

cards.term: characterized by decreases and absences in certain normal behaviors, emotions, or drives, such as an expressionless face, lack of motivation to engage in activities, reduced speech, lack of social engagement, and inability to experience pleasure
cards.definition: negative symptom

cards.term: neurodevelopmental disorder
cards.definition: one of the disorders that are first diagnosed in childhood and involve developmental problems in academic, intellectual, social functioning

cards.term: one of the disorders that are first diagnosed in childhood and involve developmental problems in academic, intellectual, social functioning
cards.definition: neurodevelopmental disorder

cards.term: obsessive-compulsive and related disorders
cards.definition: group of overlapping disorders listed in the DSM-5 that involves intrusive, unpleasant thoughts and/or repetitive behaviors

cards.term: group of overlapping disorders listed in the DSM-5 that involves intrusive, unpleasant thoughts and/or repetitive behaviors
cards.definition: obsessive-compulsive and related disorders

cards.term: obsessive-compulsive disorder
cards.definition: characterized by the tendency to experience intrusive and unwanted thoughts and urges (obsession) and/or the need to engage in repetitive behaviors or mental acts (compulsions) in response to the unwanted thoughts and urges

cards.term: characterized by the tendency to experience intrusive and unwanted thoughts and urges (obsession) and/or the need to engage in repetitive behaviors or mental acts (compulsions) in response to the unwanted thoughts and urges
cards.definition: obsessive-compulsive disorder

cards.term: orbitofrontal cortex
cards.definition: area of the frontal lobe involved in learning and decision-making

cards.term: area of the frontal lobe involved in learning and decision-making
cards.definition: orbitofrontal cortex

cards.term: panic attack
cards.definition: period of extreme fear or discomfort that develops abruptly; symptoms of panic attacks are both physiological and psychological

cards.term: period of extreme fear or discomfort that develops abruptly; symptoms of panic attacks are both physiological and psychological
cards.definition: panic attack

cards.term: panic disorder
cards.definition: anxiety disorder characterized by unexpected panic attacks, along with at least one month of worry about panic attacks or self-defeating behavior related to the attacks

cards.term: anxiety disorder characterized by unexpected panic attacks, along with at least one month of worry about panic attacks or self-defeating behavior related to the attacks
cards.definition: panic disorder

cards.term: paranoid delusion
cards.definition: characterized by beliefs that others are out to harm them

cards.term: characterized by beliefs that others are out to harm them
cards.definition: paranoid delusion

cards.term: peripartum onset
cards.definition: subtype of depression that applies to women who experience an episode of major depression either during pregnancy or in the four weeks following childbirth

cards.term: subtype of depression that applies to women who experience an episode of major depression either during pregnancy or in the four weeks following childbirth
cards.definition: peripartum onset

cards.term: persistent depressive disorder
cards.definition: depressive disorder characterized by a chronically sad and melancholy mood

cards.term: depressive disorder characterized by a chronically sad and melancholy mood
cards.definition: persistent depressive disorder

cards.term: personality disorder
cards.definition: group of DSM-5 disorders characterized by an inflexible and pervasive personality style that differs markedly from the expectations of one's culture and causes distress and impairment; people with these disorders have a personality style that frequently brings them into conflict with others and disrupts their ability to develop and maintain social relationships

cards.term: group of DSM-5 disorders characterized by an inflexible and pervasive personality style that differs markedly from the expectations of one's culture and causes distress and impairment; people with these disorders have a personality style that frequently brings them into conflict with others and disrupts their ability to develop and maintain social relationships
cards.definition: personality disorder

cards.term: posttraumatic stress disorder (PTSD)
cards.definition: experiencing a profoundly traumatic event leads to a constellation of symptoms that include intrusive and distressing memories of the event, avoidance of stimuli connected to the event, negative emotional states, feelings of detachment from others, irritability, proneness toward outbursts, hypervigilance, and a tendency to startle easily; these symptoms must occur for at least one month

cards.term: experiencing a profoundly traumatic event leads to a constellation of symptoms that include intrusive and distressing memories of the event, avoidance of stimuli connected to the event, negative emotional states, feelings of detachment from others, irritability, proneness toward outbursts, hypervigilance, and a tendency to startle easily; these symptoms must occur for at least one month
cards.definition: posttraumatic stress disorder (PTSD)

cards.term: prodromal symptom
cards.definition: in schizophrenia, one of the early minor symptoms of psychosis

cards.term: in schizophrenia, one of the early minor symptoms of psychosis
cards.definition: prodromal symptom

cards.term: psychological disorder
cards.definition: condition characterized by abnormal thoughts, feelings, and behaviors

cards.term: condition characterized by abnormal thoughts, feelings, and behaviors
cards.definition: psychological disorder

cards.term: psychopathology
cards.definition: study of psychological disorders, including their symptoms, causes, and treatment; manifestation of a psychological disorder

cards.term: study of psychological disorders, including their symptoms, causes, and treatment; manifestation of a psychological disorder
cards.definition: psychopathology

cards.term: rumination
cards.definition: in depression, tendency to repetitively and passively dwell on one's depressed symptoms, their meanings, and their consequences

cards.term: in depression, tendency to repetitively and passively dwell on one's depressed symptoms, their meanings, and their consequences
cards.definition: rumination

cards.term: safety behavior
cards.definition: mental and behavior acts designed to reduce anxiety in social situations by reducing the chance of negative social outcomes; common in social anxiety disorder

cards.term: mental and behavior acts designed to reduce anxiety in social situations by reducing the chance of negative social outcomes; common in social anxiety disorder
cards.definition: safety behavior

cards.term: schizophrenia
cards.definition: severe disorder characterized by major disturbances in thought, perception, emotion, and behavior with symptoms that include hallucinations, delusions, disorganized thinking and behavior, and negative symptoms

cards.term: severe disorder characterized by major disturbances in thought, perception, emotion, and behavior with symptoms that include hallucinations, delusions, disorganized thinking and behavior, and negative symptoms
cards.definition: schizophrenia

cards.term: seasonal pattern
cards.definition: subtype of depression in which a person experiences the symptoms of major depressive disorder only during a particular time of year

cards.term: subtype of depression in which a person experiences the symptoms of major depressive disorder only during a particular time of year
cards.definition: seasonal pattern

cards.term: social anxiety disorder
cards.definition: characterized by extreme and persistent fear or anxiety and avoidance of social situations in which one could potentially be evaluated negatively by others

cards.term: characterized by extreme and persistent fear or anxiety and avoidance of social situations in which one could potentially be evaluated negatively by others
cards.definition: social anxiety disorder

cards.term: somatic delusion
cards.definition: belief that something highly unusual is happening to one's body or internal organs

cards.term: belief that something highly unusual is happening to one's body or internal organs
cards.definition: somatic delusion

cards.term: specific phobia
cards.definition: anxiety disorder characterized by excessive, distressing, and persistent fear or anxiety about a specific object or situation

cards.term: anxiety disorder characterized by excessive, distressing, and persistent fear or anxiety about a specific object or situation
cards.definition: specific phobia

cards.term: suicidal ideation
cards.definition: thoughts of death by suicide, thinking about or planning suicide, or making a suicide attempt

cards.term: thoughts of death by suicide, thinking about or planning suicide, or making a suicide attempt
cards.definition: suicidal ideation

cards.term: suicide
cards.definition: death caused by intentional, self-directed injurious behavior

cards.term: death caused by intentional, self-directed injurious behavior
cards.definition: suicide

cards.term: supernatural
cards.definition: describes a force beyond scientific understanding

cards.term: describes a force beyond scientific understanding
cards.definition: supernatural

cards.term: ventricle
cards.definition: one of the fluid-filled cavities within the brain

cards.term: one of the fluid-filled cavities within the brain
cards.definition: ventricle

cards.term: In the harmful dysfunction definition of psychological disorders, dysfunction involves ________.
cards.definition: The inability of a psychological mechanism to perform its function

cards.term: The inability of a psychological mechanism to perform its function
cards.definition: In the harmful dysfunction definition of psychological disorders, dysfunction involves ________.

cards.term: Patterns of inner experience and behavior are thought to reflect the presence of a psychological disorder if they ________.
cards.definition: Lead to significant distress and impairment in one's life

cards.term: Lead to significant distress and impairment in one's life
cards.definition: Patterns of inner experience and behavior are thought to reflect the presence of a psychological disorder if they ________.

cards.term: The letters in the abbreviation DSM-5 stand for ________.
cards.definition: Diagnostic and Statistical Manual of Mental Disorders

cards.term: Diagnostic and Statistical Manual of Mental Disorders
cards.definition: The letters in the abbreviation DSM-5 stand for ________.

cards.term: A study based on over 9,000 U. S. residents found that the most prevalent disorder was ________.
cards.definition: Major depressive disorder

cards.definition: A study based on over 9,000 U. S. residents found that the most prevalent disorder was ________.

cards.term: The diathesis-stress model presumes that psychopathology results from ________.
cards.definition: Vulnerability and adverse experiences

cards.definition: The diathesis-stress model presumes that psychopathology results from ________.

cards.term: Dr. Anastasia believes that major depressive disorder is caused by an over-secretion of cortisol. His view on the cause of major depressive disorder reflects a ________ perspective.
cards.definition: Biological

cards.definition: Generalized anxiety disorder

cards.term: Generalized anxiety disorder

cards.term: Which of the following would constitute a safety behavior?
cards.definition: Avoiding eye contact

cards.term: Which of the following best illustrates a compulsion?
cards.definition: Mentally counting backward from 1,000

cards.term: Mentally counting backward from 1,000

cards.term: Research indicates that the symptoms of OCD ________.
cards.definition: Are related to hyperactivity in the orbitofrontal cortex

cards.term: Are related to hyperactivity in the orbitofrontal cortex
cards.definition: Research indicates that the symptoms of OCD ________.

cards.term: Symptoms of PTSD include all of the following except ________.
cards.definition: Physical complaints that cannot be explained medically

cards.term: Physical complaints that cannot be explained medically

cards.term: Which of the following elevates the risk for developing PTSD?
cards.definition: Severity of the trauma

cards.term: Severity of the trauma

cards.definition: Periods of extreme elation and euphoria

cards.term: Periods of extreme elation and euphoria
cards.definition: Common symptoms of major depressive disorder include all of the following except ________.

cards.term: Suicide rates are ________ among men than among women, and they are ________ during the winter holiday season than during the spring months.
cards.definition: Higher; lower

cards.term: Higher; lower
cards.definition: Suicide rates are ________ among men than among women, and they are ________ during the winter holiday season than during the spring months.

cards.term: Clifford falsely believes that the police have planted secret cameras in his home to monitor his every movement. Clifford's belief is an example of ________.
cards.definition: A delusion

cards.term: A delusion

cards.term: A study of adoptees whose biological mothers had schizophrenia found that the adoptees were most likely to develop schizophrenia ________.
cards.definition: If they were raised in a disturbed adoptive home environment

cards.term: If they were raised in a disturbed adoptive home environment

cards.definition: Memory loss following stress

cards.definition: Different personalities

cards.definition: Are impulsive and unpredictable

cards.definition: Emotional deficits

cards.definition: Restricted and fixated interest

cards.definition: Difficulty relating to others

cards.term: Difficulty relating to others

cards.term: Psychological Disorder (APA)
cards.definition: Significant disturbances in thoughts, feelings, and behaviors that reflect dysfunction (biological, psychological, developmental), cause significant distress/disability, and do not reflect expected cultural responses.

cards.term: Significant disturbances in thoughts, feelings, and behaviors that reflect dysfunction (biological, psychological, developmental), cause significant distress/disability, and do not reflect expected cultural responses.
cards.definition: Psychological Disorder (APA)

cards.term: Dysfunction
cards.definition: Occurs when an internal mechanism breaks down and can no longer perform its normal function.

cards.term: Occurs when an internal mechanism breaks down and can no longer perform its normal function.
cards.definition: Dysfunction

cards.term: Harmful Dysfunction
cards.definition: Model where a dysfunction leads to negative consequences for the individual or others, as judged by cultural standards.

cards.term: Model where a dysfunction leads to negative consequences for the individual or others, as judged by cultural standards.
cards.definition: Harmful Dysfunction

cards.term: DSM-5
cards.definition: Diagnostic and Statistical Manual of Mental Disorders (5th edition). The classification system used by most mental health professionals in the U.S.

cards.term: Diagnostic and Statistical Manual of Mental Disorders (5th edition). The classification system used by most mental health professionals in the U.S.
cards.definition: DSM-5

cards.term: Anxiety Disorders
cards.definition: Characterized by excessive and persistent fear and anxiety, and by related disturbances in behavior.

cards.term: Characterized by excessive and persistent fear and anxiety, and by related disturbances in behavior.
cards.definition: Anxiety Disorders

cards.term: Obsessive-Compulsive Disorder (OCD)
cards.definition: Characterized by intrusive/unwanted thoughts (obsessions) and the need to engage in repetitive behaviors/mental acts (compulsions).

cards.term: Characterized by intrusive/unwanted thoughts (obsessions) and the need to engage in repetitive behaviors/mental acts (compulsions).
cards.definition: Obsessive-Compulsive Disorder (OCD)

cards.term: Hallucination vs. Delusion
cards.definition: Hallucination: perceptual experience without external stimulation. Delusion: belief that is contrary to reality and firmly held despite contradictory evidence.

cards.term: Hallucination: perceptual experience without external stimulation. Delusion: belief that is contrary to reality and firmly held despite contradictory evidence.
cards.definition: Hallucination vs. Delusion

cards.term: ADHD
cards.definition: Childhood disorder characterized by a constant pattern of inattention and/or hyperactive and impulsive behavior.

cards.term: Childhood disorder characterized by a constant pattern of inattention and/or hyperactive and impulsive behavior.
cards.definition: ADHD
